forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 56. West southwest wind around 12 mph.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 67, with temperatures falling to around 65 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 6 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph.

weather_report:
Tonight in Downtown San Francisco, the transition into evening promises a gentle embrace of a partly cloudy sky. The air holds a mildness, resting comfortably at around 56 degrees, punctuated by a soothing west-southwest breeze. As the sun sets, the city may take on a tranquil yet slightly muted charm, with the dusky silhouettes of buildings softened against the twilight.

Thursday beckons with a brighter spirit, offering promise and warmth as the day unfurls. The forecast suggests a nearly sun-soaked morning evolving into a sunny afternoon, with temperatures peaking close to 67 degrees before settling around a more familiar 65. The southwest wind will playfully ruffle your hair at speeds between 6 and 18 mph, perhaps inviting the faintest gusts up to 23 mph which can send a delightful chill through the air. Given the conditions, a light jacket or a breathable layer would be the ideal attire, allowing you to adjust as the day warms. 

As for activities, consider wandering through the neighborhoods, where the vibrant street life and eclectic architecture wait to greet you. Stop by a local café for a warm beverage, people-watch, or perhaps stroll along the Embarcadero to take in breathtaking views of the bay, all while relishing the embrace of a glorious day devoid of fog and brimming with clarity.
